title: Junior Data Analyst
description_html:
PracovnÃ­ nabÃ­dka

Weâ€™re looking for Junior Data Analyst to support our Analytical Unit in BI department!

Key responsibilities:

  • Collect business requirements cross BS departments

  • Build and maintain dashboards in Power BI
  • Write basic SQL queries to extract and combine data from different tables
  • Track KPIs and investigate changes, anomalies, and trends
  • Document data definitions and reporting logic to keep work consistent
  • Support data quality checks and help improve reporting processes
  • Present findings in aÂ clear, simple way (charts, summaries, and recommendations)

Required qualifications:

  • Comfortable with Excel/Google Sheets (pivot tables, formulas, charts)
  • Basic knowledge of SQL (SELECT, JOINs, GROUP BY)
  • At least basic experience with Power BI
  • Strong attention to detail and good communication skills
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines
  • Communicative and able to maintain long term relationship with business units

Nice to have:

  • Some Python or R (pandas, notebooks)
  • Familiarity with analytics and mailing tools (GA4, Exponea, etc.)
  • Understanding of data modeling basics and ETL concepts

Benefits:

  • Work in aÂ modern and stable company
  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunity to work with aÂ dynamic and growing team
  • Chance to work on innovative and exciting projects
  • Opportunities for professional development and training

  • Meal allowance of CZK 123/day

  • MultiSport card for only CZK 500
  • Cafeteria Benefit Plus
  • Discounts on company products

title: Software Engineer
description_html:
PracovnÃ­ nabÃ­dka

At Bruker weâ€™re building cutting-edge solutions around mass spectrometry and identification of bacteria that power the future of microbiology and infectious disease diagnostics. We believe in artificial intelligence, automation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

Bruker s.r.o., aÂ daughter company of Bruker Daltonics GmbH & Co. KG aÂ globally acknowledged leader in mass spectrometry instrumentation and other scientific instruments is looking for aÂ Software Engineer with DevOps knowledge for Research and Development department in Brno, Czechia. We offer the full-time employment relationship and date of commencement of employment as soon as possible (by agreement).


What Do We Offer?

  • Friendly, inclusive, and innovative team culture
  • Competitive salary and performance bonuses
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work model (3 days office / 2 days from home)
  • Professional development budget and certifications
  • Opportunity to work on impactful projects with modern technologies

If you're passionate about software development, DevOps culture and love working with modern tech stacks, we want to hear from you!

What Youâ€™ll Do?

  • As aÂ Software Developer, you will be an integral part of aÂ team focused on developing modern automation technologies. Due to the nature of the work, which involves direct interaction with physical devices, this position is not fully remote and requires certain degree of on-site presence to interact with colleagues and devices.
  • In addition to software development responsibilities, you might also take on DevOps-related or Cybersecurity-related tasks, including the setup and maintenance of project infrastructure. Your role will involve identifying inefficiencies and reliability issues within the software development lifecycle, monitoring system resources and services, software vulnerabilities, and ensuring seamless integration and operation of all components. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will collaborate closely with both the development team and the IT department.
  • It is important to note that once the project infrastructure is established, the running project must adhere to corporate guidelines, ISO/IEC standards, and EU/US directives and regulations governing development and documentation practices. These standards are aÂ fundamental part of our daily operations. Ultimately, we are developing medical devices, which are subject to strict regulatory requirements, and maintaining compliance is aÂ critical aspect of our work.

What Weâ€™re Looking For?

  • Master, or corresponding qualification in Informatics, Electronics, Mathematics, or Physics.
  • Friendly and communicative person with English (and Czech) on professional level.

- You need to be very communicative, and independent, as well as team player.

- You cannot get discouraged when your requests will take long in corporate IT.

- You need to be developer who can set up infrastructure for team projects.

  • Development focus (one of following two bullet points).

- Focus on .NET and C#/C++, WPF, Blazer, etc.

- The following would be aÂ big advantage but is not mandatory: MCUs, C/C++, Qt, Yocto, Linux, etc.

  • Other responsibilities.

- Scripting and Building like Bash/PowerShell, Python, Maven, Ansible.

- DevOps and CI/CD like Azure DevOps (Cloud, Git/Repos, Pipelines, Artifactsâ€¦).

Ready to Join Us? Please submit your resume in English together with aÂ brief cover letter.

title: We're building a pipeline of RPA Developers at every level
description_html:
Location:

KoÅ¡ice, SK, 040 01

Requisition ID: 15376

Holcim is the leading partner for sustainable construction, creating value across the built environment from infrastructure and industry to buildings. Headquartered in Zug, Switzerland, Holcim has more than 48,000 employees in 45 attractive markets â€“ across Europe, Latin America, Asia, Middle East & Africa. Holcim offers high-value end-to-end Building Materials and Building Solutions, from foundations and flooring to roofing and walling â€“ powered by premium brands including ECOPlanet, ECOPact, and ECOCycleÂ®. Find out more at www.holcim.com

Role Overview

Do you enjoy creating automated solutions? Would you like to participate in different projects that make work simpler and more efficient?

If you are passionate about Automation Anywhere and UiPath, we would be happy to welcome you in the process!

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Understanding business processes in order to design automation solution
  • Programming automation solution (in UiPath, Automation Anywhere, Javascript), creating supporting applications for the automation process if required (Google Apps, Appsheet, â€¦)
  • Performing UAT for created automation solution, to guarantee operation according to requirements
  • Monitoring of automation in a productive environment during the stabilization phase, in order to guarantee the correct functioning of the automation and timely correct any errors that are generated
  • Performing changes in parameterizations of automation, implementing changes in order to guarantee the stabilization of the process and its optimal functioning
  • Creating supporting documentation for automation


Your Qualifications, Experience And Skills

  • Proficient in one of the core coding languages (Java, C#, VB, Python, referable .Net/Java/Javascript programming skills)
  • Programming and Application Development (Google apps, Appsheet, OADocs, UiPath, Automation Anywhere)
  • Knowledge of SAP, ServiceNow, web applications, ability to understand business requirements
  • Expert in MS Office/GSuite, Fluent in English (C1)
  • Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile
  • Good teamwork skills and a strong collaborative spirit
  • Ability to adapt to a dynamic environment with changing focus


Benefits

  • Annual 5% Bonus
  • Grade-Related Bonus
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Supplementary Pension Fund
  • Working Anniversary Awards
  • Flexible Working Hours
  • Hybrid Contract
  • Sick Days
  • Mental Health Support
  • Multisport Card


Holcim is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We support equal opportunities for everyone, regardless of race, national origin, gender, sexuality, disability, or age.

title: Data Engineer
description_html:
As a Data Engineer, you would be a part of data-centric activities at the enterprise level in the Company. You will be providing support to various members of the Data team with database design, data flow and analysis activities. You will play a key role in the development and deployment of innovative data platforms for advanced analytics and data processing. You will be taking part in data management activities such as analysing complex data elements and systems, data flow, dependencies, and relationships to ensure that they comply with the data governance program.

Your Focus

  • Perform ad-hoc analyses of data stored in the businessâ€™s MySQL/MS SQL databases and develop SQL code.
  • Understand business requirements, build and tune prototypes encapsulating advanced business logic
  • Analyse, prototype and develop data transformations and analytical calculations in Data warehouse and Data marts
  • Perform thorough testing and validation in order to support the accuracy of data transformations and data verification used in analytics. Strive to ensure proper data governance and quality across the Data department and the business as a whole
  • Participate in data management activities such as analyse complex data elements and systems, data flow, dependencies, and relationships in order to contribute to conceptual physical and logical data models.
  • Provide support to the entire department for its data-centric needs.
  • Keep up with industry trends and best practices, advising on new and improved data engineering strategies that will drive departmental performance leading to overall improvement in data governance across the business, promoting informed decision-making, and ultimately improving overall business performance.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Good understanding of financial services and banking domain to be able to understand business requirements and propose solutions
  • Strong understanding of databases and data structures.
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to discuss and clarify business requirements
  • Fluent English, both written and verbal.
  • Proficiency in MS SQL server development (T-SQL):
    • design, build, and maintain operational and ETL pipelines
    • tune queries performance
    • experience with CLR Integration is an advantage
    • experience with Azure data tech stack is an advantage
    • Good self management and ability to meet agreed sprint goals based on prioritization discussed with delivery lead
We Offer

  • A Truly Global Workplace â€“ collaborate with 40+ nationalities across 25+ countries, embracing diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural innovation
  • Hybrid & Flexible Work â€“ balance your life and career with remote-friendly policies and modern offices across Europe
  • A Culture of Growth â€“ accelerate your development with access to LinkedIn Learning, structured mentorship, and internal leadership programmes (HiPo & People Leader tracks)
  • Workation Programme â€“ work remotely from abroad for up to 2 months per year and experience new cultures while staying connected and productive
  • Financial Growth Opportunities â€“ invest in your future with our share purchase matching programme, doubling your contributions and fostering long-term rewards
  • Extra Time to Recharge â€“ enjoy 4 fully paid sick days per year to rest when needed
  • Stay Active â€“ access to the MultiSport card, supporting your fitness, wellness, and relaxation goals
  • Healthy Office Culture â€“ enjoy fresh snacks and refreshments daily in a modern workspace
  • Up Benefia â€“ choose the perks that suit you best with our flexible benefits system, giving you a set budget to spend on categories like fashion, wellness, dining, education, entertainment, and more

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support specific parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses against predefined criteria. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. All final hiring decisions are made by human recruiters.

By proceeding to apply for a job with us, you confirm that you have read and accepted our Recruitment Privacy Policy

title: Specialist II - Materials Inspection
description_html:
About Convatec

Pioneering trusted medical solutions to improve the lives we touch: Convatec is a global medical products and technologies company, focused on solutions for the management of chronic conditions, with leading positions in Advanced Wound Care, Ostomy Care, Continence Care, and Infusion Care. With more than 10,000 colleagues, we provide our products and services in around 90 countries, united by a promise to be forever caring. Our solutions provide a range of benefits, from infection prevention and protection of at-risk skin, to improved patient outcomes and reduced care costs. Convatecâ€™s revenues in 2024 were over $2 billion. The company is a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index (LSE:CTEC). To learn more please visit http://www.convatecgroup.com

Place of work:â€¯PriemyselnÃ½ park 3, Michalovce, Slovakia

Wage (gross) and other rewards:â€¯ Minimum 1450â‚¬ / monthly (depending on experiences and quality of the candidate) + quarterly bonus and other benefits in compliance with social benefit program of the company

Contract type:â€¯full-time

Start date:â€¯by agreement

The role:

The Specialist II â€“ Materials Inspection is responsible for inspecting purchase parts and materials to ensure conformity with standards, specifications, and processing requirements. The role involves dimensional and visual inspections using automated equipment and precision tools (micrometers, gauges, calipers) and verification against purchase orders, blueprints, drawings, and isnpection instructions. The position ensures compliance with technical requirements, makes pass/fail decisions, and maintains accurate inspeciton records. Success in this role contributes to product quality and reulatory compliance.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform inspections of incoming materials for identity, dimensions, and visual defects (e.g., corrosion, cracks, dents, scratches, pits).
  • Evaluate statistical data, prepare reports, and perform data analysis.
  • Participate in creating procedures, reviewing them, and updating as necessary within the assigned area.
  • Use measuring devices such as automated inspection equipment, micrometers, gauges, calipers, microscopes, telescope gauges, and optical comparators.
  • Verify specifications using purchase orders, blueprints, drawings, inspection instructions, and checklists.
  • Make pass/fail decisions on inspected goods and maintain detailed records of results.
  • Review and approve inspection reports against technical requirements.
  • Apply practical knowledge of job area to resolve moderately difficult problems.
  • Drive quality improvements through system simplification.
  • Ensure compliance with EHS and quality system requirements.
  • Participate in continuous improvement initiatives and cross-functional projects as required.
  • To ensure compliance with the legislative and internal requirements of the EHS and to participate in the fulfillment of the company's targets in the EHS area.


Authority (if applicable):

Authorized to make pass/fail decisions on inspected materials based on established specifications.

May approve inspection reports within defined technical requirements.

Skills & Experience:

Practical knowledge of inspection techniques and quality standards.

Experience with precision measuring instruments and automated inspection systems.

Ability to interpret technical drawings and specifications.

Strong attention to detail and documentation accuracy.

Basic IT skills for data entry and report generation.

Good communication skills for cross-functional collaboration.

Qualifications/Education:

Minimum Secondary school education

Must be able to perform general math and algebra functions and understanding of Basic Statistics technics

Proficient in use of MS Word, Excel and Outlook

Experience In Quality Inspection Or Related Field (preferred)

Familiarity with ISO 13485 and related standards is an advantage

Preferred training requirements:

Introduction training for administrative employees

Quality System documents and procedures relevant to all employees (local and Convatec corporate e.g. Code of Ethics and Business Conduct, Quality Policy, Complaints, relevant GxP documents), including regular re-training when required

Quality System documents and procedures relevant to job performance

Principal Contacts & Purpose of Contact

Internal â€“ Multiple roles â€“ primarily for activities related to the inspection of incoming materials, including ITQA for validation of measuring equipment

External â€“ Equipment suppliers for testing incoming materials, calibraiton and maintenance service providers for equipments related to incoming testing, and suppliers of incoming materials.

Travel Requirements

Occasionally, and primarily during the training period, the frequency may increase.

Languages

  • Speaking: Yes English
  • Writing/Reading: Yes English


Working Conditions (Applicable local workplace laws and statutes should be included in the description of working conditions)

Office based position with home office possibilities based on the local home office policy

Flexible working hours

Work in the laboratory on PC

Team player

Organized person

Our ambitions will bring the very best out in you. Youâ€™ll be pushed to aim higher and really own your work. Youâ€™ll be encouraged and supported to make things happen, too. It can be challenging. But, as the progress you make will help improve the lives of millions, itâ€™ll be worth it.

This is stepping up to a challenge.

This is work thatâ€™ll move you.

Note: Please send your CV only in English language.

Employee perks, and benefits:

  • Annual global incentive plan-bonus.
  • Large corporations with representation and manufacturing plants in the world.
  • Stable employer for Michalovce city and its surroundings.
  • Corporate culture â€“ Underpinning everything we do are our values:
  • Improve care
  • Deliver results
  • Grow together
  • Own it
  • Do whatÂ´s right
  • Convatec Day â€“ an extra day off.
  • Home office possibilities.
  • Flexible working hours.
  • Introduction program according to company standards.
  • Development training.
  • Career opportunities for internal employees.
  • Referral bonus system.
  • Recognition program.
  • Meals in the amount of 0.44 Eur per one meal unit/day.
  • Supplementary pension plan after the trial period with the employer's contribution.
  • Social fund (various support and perks for employees).
  • Free bus transport within Michalovce city.
  • Various events/team building activities for employees.
  • Various employee discounts by vendors within Michalovce city.


Working Conditions:

  • Work in office environment, production centers and laboratory
  • Availability to travel, international and national.


Company:

Unomedicalâ€¯s.r.o. (member of the global company Convatec)

PriemyselnÃ½ park 3â€¯

071 01 Michalovce, Slovakia

Email: job-slovakia@convatec.com

A formal recruitment process is required for all our opportunities prior to any offer of employment. This will include an interview confirmed by an official ConvaTec email address.

If you receive a suspicious approach over social media, text message, email or phone call about recruitment at ConvaTec, do not disclose any personal information or pay any fees whatsoever. If youâ€™re unsure, please contact us at careers@convatec.com.

title: We're building a pipeline of QlikView Developers at every level
description_html:
Location:

KoÅ¡ice, SK, 040 01

Requisition ID: 15383

Holcim is the leading partner for sustainable construction, creating value across the built environment from infrastructure and industry to buildings. Headquartered in Zug, Switzerland, Holcim has more than 48,000 employees in 45 attractive markets â€“ across Europe, Latin America, Asia, Middle East & Africa. Holcim offers high-value end-to-end Building Materials and Building Solutions, from foundations and flooring to roofing and walling â€“ powered by premium brands including ECOPlanet, ECOPact, and ECOCycleÂ®. Find out more at www.holcim.com

Role Overview

The Global Hub Analytics & Reporting (GHAR) team was established in 2020 to provide data and reporting services to Corporate Functions from our Global Hub. Our portfolio currently drives efficiency through data validation and automation, master data standardization and analysis, as well as dashboards - including QlikView.

Responsibilities will be to:

The role of QlikView Developer is a part of the GHAR team.

  • This role is dedicated to the development of the applications focused on measurement of the activities and processes in QlikView.
  • You will administer, modify MS Excel tables and create new tables in the network environment.
  • In this role, you will develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.As well, you will work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs, and locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
  • You will participate in the Analytical/Reporting/AI forums/workshops to oversee current trends in the technology and systems.
  • Last but not least, you will also have an opportunity to train other members of the team/company to build awareness/best practices and common knowledge about the tools and strategy.


Your Qualifications, Experience And Skills

  • University education (Masterâ€™s degree) in Business, Finance, Accounting, IT Engineering
  • English - upper intermediate (B2)
  • Knowledge of QlikView, SQL, other databases and mastery in Excel
  • Programming skills in QlikView/Reporting/Analytical tools (SAP, FC/BW) â€“ is an advantage
  • Knowledge in other tools such as Axiom, Tableau, Data base â€“ is an advantage
  • Organization skills, ability to prioritize tasks, proactive professional attitude
  • Creativity to identify, present and deliver process improvements
  • Strong technical & automation skills
  • You are confident, eager to learn, detail oriented and a team player


Benefits

  • Annual 5% Bonus
  • Grade-Related Bonus
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Supplementary Pension Fund
  • Working Anniversary Awards
  • Flexible Working Hours
  • Hybrid Contract
  • Sick Days
  • Mental Health Support
  • Multisport Card


Holcim is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We support equal opportunities for everyone, regardless of race, national origin, gender, sexuality, disability, or age.

title: SuccessFactors Application Maintenance Specialist
description_html:
About Technology Consulting

We connect the world of business with technologies from design to implementation. In Technology Consulting, you are not only a part of PwC, but you will also get the opportunity to get to know life in other companies. Usually, we are part of project teams responsible for the design and delivery of innovative and high-quality Business and Technology solutions for our clients in the Czech Republic and other European countries.

We are developing our skill sets not only when working with our clients but also in additional activities. We have six communities, where we learn about specific topics â€“ Self-Mastery, Innovations and Start-up Development, Data Management, Digital Strategy, SAP, AI

About Your Manager

Eva HlavÃ¡ÄovÃ¡ leads the Employee Central & Compensation team for SAP SuccessFactors. She dedicates her professional life to the implementation of HR systems for Czech and international clients. When she's not at work, she likes skiing, yoga and books.

Job Description & Summary

Are you looking to advance your career in HR IT with a focus on supporting and enhancing modern HR systems? Do you enjoy ensuring stability, continuously improving system functionality, and helping organizations get the most out of their HR technologies? We are looking for an Application Maintenance Expert with handsâ€‘on experience in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to join our global HR IT operations team.

In this role, you will work closely with HR system owners, key users, and technical teams to ensure the smooth operation of Employee Central and related modules. You will be responsible for issue analysis, configuration updates, enhancements, release management and testing. You can also gain additional experience by supporting your colleagues during peak times on the implementation projects. You will apply your analytical skills, functional understanding, and attention to detail to keep the platform reliable, compliant, and continuously improving.

Requirements of the role

  • Strong interest in HRIT solutions and modern HR technology trends.
  • Practical experience with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (admin, configuration, or operational support).
  • Experience with additional SAP SuccessFactors modules is an advantage.
  • Willingness to work on configuration changes, incident resolution, problem management, and system enhancements.
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical topics in a businessâ€‘friendly and userâ€‘friendly way.
  • Fluent in Czech and English; German is an advantage.
  • Willingness for occasional international travel.
  • University degree.

Our Benefits and Funâ€¯

  • Concentrated experience and rapid career growth. It may sound like a platitude, but it really is.â€¯
  • Fair salary plus paid overtime and flexible working hours.
  • Paid time off 25 days, 3 wellbeing days and 2 extra days off from the company at the end of the year.â€¯
  • High-end Ultrabook and iPhone with unlimited data.â€¯
  • Benefit program with 45.000 points that you can use for holidays, education, food vouchers, sports, health... Simply on what you enjoy.â€¯â€¯
  • Supporting your development and education: business and digital skills training (e.g. Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau), ongoing training and certifications, e.g. Microsoft (Azure, PowerApps), project management (Prince2, PMI), service management (ITIL), agile development (Scrum, SAFe), DAMA, Salesforce, coaching and presentation skills and more. And various training within our technology communities.â€¯
  • Opportunity to work in the future at a foreign PwC office, for example in the USA, Canada and there are others in the selection.â€¯â€¯
  • Extra-work activities and Away Days (team building, ski weekend, etc.).â€¯â€¯
  • Regular feedback on your work, also consultation with a coach with whom you can address your further development and career direction.â€¯

PwC is the largest audit team in the Czech Republic, but also law, tax, consulting and technology, data or forensic teams. Find out how easy it is to combine this knowledge when you're in the right place. With us, you will get the opportunity to see how business is done in large companies. We are part of an international network of companies with more than 364,000 colleagues in 151 countries. At PwC, we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can be themselves and find their place and opportunity to develop. We have successfully maintained the prestigious Equal Pay Certification, making us one of only four companies in the Czech Republic (and the only one from the Big 4) that demonstrably implements fair compensation practices regardless of gender.â€¯

Are you interested in our offer? Let us know about yourself and we will discuss more details together!â€¯

title: Junior CRO Specialist
description_html:
About Us

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior CRO Specialist to join our high-performing team. In this role, you will support our mission to drive measurable improvements in conversion rates across our digital products.

This position is perfect for someone eager to grow in the field of CROâ€”someone analytical, curious, detail-oriented, and keen to learn by doing. As a Junior CRO Manager, you will work closely with experienced CRO specialists, assisting in the research, planning, and execution of experiments that directly impact business outcomes. Youâ€™ll gain hands-on experience with A/B testing, funnel analysis, and UI/UX design, all while contributing to high-impact projects.

The ideal candidate is passionate about user behavior, optimization strategies, and digital experimentation, and is eager to build a career in a fast-paced, results-driven environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in conducting funnel and user behavior analyses to identify optimization opportunities
  • Support the development of hypotheses based on data insights, research, and industry best practices
  • Help design test plans and coordinate the execution of A/B and multivariate experiments
  • Collaborate with designers and developers to implement and QA test variations
  • Analyze experiment results using statistical methods and contribute to documenting insights
  • Maintain accurate records of tests and outcomes to support cross-team knowledge sharing

Qualifications

  • 6+ months of experience (internship, freelance, or entry-level role) in CRO, digital marketing, data analysis, or UI/UX
  • Basic understanding of A/B testing and digital analytics
  • Familiarity with tools such as Google Analytics, Hotjar, or similar platforms
  • Strong analytical skills and keen attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
  • Proactive mindset with a strong desire to learn and grow in a dynamic environment
  • Foundational understanding of UI/UX principles with the ability to create mockups that align with brand standards

Nice to have

  • Experience with CRO platforms like Growthbook, VWO, or Optimizely
  • Basic design skills using Figma, Adobe XD, Lovable, V0
  • Previous experience working remotely or within cross-functional teams
  • Interest in subscription-based business models

Location

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately Â± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:

  • Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance.
  • Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days.
  • Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge.
  • Company-provided MacBook: Experience seamless productivity with top-notch Apple MacBooks provided to all employees who need them.
  • Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tzxGX4Uu7Ts_HCLFXESKLnKaaBfVCPf1f9AYZPrkjJM/preview?tab=t.0

Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Interview Process

After submitting your application, we conduct a thorough review which typically takes 3 to 5 days, but may occasionally take longer due to the volume of applications received. If we see a potential fit, we proceed with the following steps:

  • Recruiter Screening (40 minutes)
  • Technical Interview (90 minutes)
  • Final Interview (60 minutes)

Life at Ruby Labs

At Ruby Labs, we move fast, aim high, and expect the same from our team. Weâ€™re not here to play smallâ€”weâ€™re here to build, grow, and win. That means we look for people who are ambitious, driven, and ready to give their best every single day.

This is a place for individuals who thrive under pressure, embrace challenges, and see opportunity in every obstacle. If youâ€™re hungry to achieve, motivated by impact, and want to grow at the speed of your own ambition, Ruby Labs offers the platform to make it happen.

Here, effort is matched with reward. We recognize those who go all in and deliver results, and we create space for people who want moreâ€”more responsibility, more growth, and more success.

title: Integration Tester for Project of Technology Modules inside RemoteIO
description_html:
At our Siemens Foundational Technologies Development Center we are focused on a product development including software development, hardware development, mechanical design, and testing for the next generation concept of Industry 4.0.

We would like to invite you to cooperate on the development of industrial automation products within established, stable, and successful development project â€ET 200 IOÂ´sâ€œ. To strengthen world leading position of ET 200 Input/Outputs, we start development of new IO modules, integration of new communication protocols and industrial EDGE technologies.

Your task will be:

  • Creating of source code in C / C ++ for embedded systems
  • Create, review, and maintain comprehensive test cases and procedures, based on products specifications
  • Perform functional, integration, system, and regression testing of prototypes (both manual and automated)
  • Maintain, and enhance test automation frameworks (Opportunity to actively shape our test systems by contributing your own ideas and influencing future test architecture.)
  • Integrate test suites into CI/CD pipelines
  • Analyze test results to identify root causes of failures
  • Design, set up, document and maintain testing environment

What we will appreciate from you:

  • Successfully completed university studies (specialization: software engineering / electronics or comparable courses).
  • Experience in testing (test design, test execution)
  • Good programming skills (C# or Python)
  • Basic knowledge of electronics or interest to learn
  • Knowledge of instrumentation for automation
  • Experience in Siemens PLC programming (SCL)
  • ISTQB certificate
  • Efficient communication skill in English language for smooth cooperation in international team

What can you gain by joining us?

More time to rest

  • Up to 33 days of vacation (5 weeks of holiday + up to 8 extra days from the benefits budget).
  • The option to take unpaid leave for rest or travel.

Flexibility and home office

  • Flexible working hours and the ability to work from home, with a contribution towards home office expenses.

Rewards and bonuses

  • Signing bonus of up to CZK 100,000 (based on the level of technical expertise).
  • Relocation bonus of up to CZK 100,000 for moving costs.

Individual Benefits Budget

  • Personal budget of at least CZK 34,000 to buy selected benefits from categories finance, wellbeing and health.

My finance

  • Contributions towards pension and/or life insurance and/or DIP (a long-term investment product) from your benefits budget.
  • Employee stock ownership plan â€“ share in the companyâ€™s success.

My wellbeing

  • Cafeteria system from the benefits budget.
  • E-meal vouchers or company canteen.
  • Company nursery in Prague and Ostrava to support working parents.
  • Exclusive employee offers and discounts.

My health

  • Discounted MultiSport card.
  • The option of access to premium healthcare and crisis support (e.g., psychological counseling).

Siemens is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. We are committed to forming a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. This is how we work best. Problem solvers and entrepreneurs are highly welcome.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens and learn more: https://www.siemens.com/global/en.html

title: Working Student for IT/OT Integration & AI - DPÄŒ
description_html:
In our global Head Quarters Application Engineering Team, we support our world-wide customers by providing solutions and services to enhance flexibility, productivity and efficiency of their machines.â€¯â€¯

Join our team as Working Student for IT/OT Integration & AI and support the development of high-end solutions for machine builders in a big variety of different industries.

What will be your main responsibilities?

  • Testing and commissioning of solutions in our demonstration facilities and dedicated IT/OT.
  • Benchmarking embedded devices for automation.
  • Evaluating and improving operational pipelines that integrate IT and OT systems.
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive innovation in automation.

You can look forward to:

  • Hands-on experience with industrial automation and industrial AI.
  • Develop your technical expertise through hands-on projects, training, and exposure to the latest tools and technologies.
  • Receive guidance and mentoring from experienced experts supporting your growth.
  • Working as part of a young and international team in a globally operating enterprise.
  • Experiencing truly international atmosphere with use of English on daily basis
  • Flexible working hours and working mode with home office / presence in the office (min. 2 days per week)
  • Possibility of a long-term cooperation in the form of an employment agreement.
  • A modern workplace in Prague â€“ StodÅ¯lky, right next to the metro B.
  • Meal voucher contribution

Why you are a good fit for us:

  • Currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Automation, Robotics, Computer Science or a related field
  • Basic understanding of industrial automation
  • Good understanding of Python for data manipulation and visualization
  • Comfortable working with Linux systems and the command line interface
  • Structured and self-reliant way of working
  • Eager to learn new technologies and skills
  • Proficient in English, both spoken and written.

What we would appreciate:

  • Experience in artificial intelligence
  • Experience in high level programming
  • Experience in web development
  • Experience in Linux embedded systems.

Siemens is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

We are committed to forming a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. This is how we work best. Problem solvers and entrepreneurs are highly welcome.

title: Junior/Middle QA Engineer
description_html:
Veeam, the #1 global market leader in data resilience, believes businesses should control all their data whenever and wherever they need it. Veeam provides data resilience through data backup, data recovery, data portability, data security, and data intelligence. Based in Seattle, Veeam protects over 550,000 customers worldwide who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running. Join us as we move forward together, growing, learning, and making a real impact for some of the worldâ€™s biggest brands. The future of data resilience is here - go fearlessly forward with us.

About The Role

Join the Veeam Quality Assurance team and work on Veeam products with experienced QA professionals in the Warsaw R&D office. QA has the power to breathe life into our products. Testers are always at the center of the action: developing an idea, thinking through functionality, and conducting a thousand complex experiments â€” and this is not the limit. Our QA work is deeply handsâ€‘on, focused on functional checks, exploratory approaches, and verifying real usage scenarios to ensure that â€œVeeam just works.â€

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • â€œDeep divingâ€ into our products, technology and profession
  • Analyzing software requirements
  • Manually testing one or several Veeam products
  • Communicating with other participants of the product development process
  • Evaluating test results, maintaining defects database

What Youâ€™ll Bring

  • Technical education background or a strong passion for technology
  • 1â€“2 years of experience in system administration, software testing, or software development
  • Strong motivation to grow professionally in the software testing field
  • Advanced knowledge of Windows or Linux operating systems
  • Good understanding of networking technologies and systems (DNS, DHCP, basic network configuration, etc.)
  • Curiosity and attention to detail, with a natural ability to identify flaws â€” key qualities for hands-on testing
  • Open-mindedness, strong common sense, and clear logical thinking
  • Fast learner with enthusiasm for interesting and challenging tasks (passion is valued as much as experience)
  • English proficiency sufficient for daily communication within international teams

What You'll Get

  • 25 vacation days, 4 sick days, 21 paid medical leave days, plus 4 extra global VeeaMe Days for self-care and 24 paid volunteer hours annually through Veeam Cares
  • Premium private medical insurance for employees and dependents
  • Daily meal vouchers for restaurants and groceries (180 CZK per working day)
  • Flexible cafeteria platform with thousands of lifestyle benefit options
  • Multisport Card for gym and wellness, with family add-on options
  • Annual public transport reimbursement up to a set limit
  • Corporate mobile plan with optional family tariff
  • Opportunities to learn and grow through on-demand libraries (LinkedIn Learning, Oâ€™Reilly), mentoring, workshops and learning events like our annual Global Day of Learning

title: Test Engineer
description_html:
Introduction to the Organization


HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in technology solutions, renowned for its commitment to innovation, operational excellence, and customer-centric approach. With a presence in over 50 countries and a team of 220,000+ professionals, HCLTech empowers organizations across industries to transform digitally and achieve sustainable growth. The companyâ€™s values center around integrity, teamwork, and continuous improvement, making it a trusted partner for Fortune 500 companies and a top employer in the technology sector.


Overview of the Role


As a Test Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of healthcare technology solutions delivered to clinics and healthcare providers. You will be responsible for designing, executing, and automating test processes that are integral to maintaining and enhancing the performance of HCLTechâ€™s healthcare software products. Your contributions will directly impact the safety, effectiveness, and compliance of solutions used in critical healthcare environments.


Detailed Responsibilities


  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align testing activities with project objectives and regulatory requirements.
  • Utilize industry-leading test management tools, such as Quality Center, Azure DevOps Test Manager, or Jama, to plan, organize, and track testing efforts.
  • Develop and implement automated test scripts using tools like Selenium or Cypress to enhance test coverage and efficiency.
  • Contribute to embedded software testing in clinic IT environments, ensuring robust integration and performance.
  • Participate in Agile development cycles, supporting continuous integration and delivery through iterative testing.
  • Plan and execute regression test strategies to ensure ongoing reliability and compliance of healthcare solutions.
  • Perform comprehensive test analysis based on approved functional requirements and conduct requirements ambiguity reviews for improved clarity.
  • Create, maintain, and deliver test documentation, including Test Plans, Test Summary Reports, and Test Case Documents.
  • Ensure verification activities are conducted with thorough documentation to support regulatory and quality standards.


Skill Requirements


  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in healthcare technology and clinic IT environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of test management tools (Quality Center, Azure DevOps Test Manager, Jama).
  • Proficient in automation testing with Selenium or Cypress.
  • Experience with embedded software development and Agile methodologies.
  • Strong skills in planning regression tests and developing comprehensive test documentation.
  • Excellent analytical skills for test analysis and requirements review.
  • Effective communication and collaboration abilities for working with diverse teams.


Other Requirements (Optional)


  • ISTQB or equivalent software testing certification is highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with healthcare compliance standards (such as HIPAA, HL7) is advantageous.
  • Experience with performance and security testing in healthcare applications is a plus.
  • Ability to work independently and adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


What We Offer


  • Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies.
  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Career growth and professional development opportunities.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

title: Software Engineer - fresh graduate
description_html:
Job Description

We are looking for Fresh graduated candidates with finishing the University in academic year 2025/2026.

Starting day June 1st, 2026 onward!

EU visa and work permission mandatory!

We are seeking a motivated Software Engineer to join our team in Prague, where you will work with experienced engineers to build Opower platform and products that make a real-world impact. In this role, you will have the chance to contribute to software development, learning how to build scalable and user-friendly products.

You will be part of an international team, providing you with plenty of exposure to various modern technologies and agile processes.

To that end, we are looking for an entry-level software developer who is passionate about building software that makes a real difference in the world, and who has the skills and strong desire to learn about software development and cloud technologies, write code in our stack, and think critically about our role in the business.

If you have experience as a professional software engineer, that's great - but, our focus is on the skills you have and skills you can develop while you're here. As long as you're ready and eager to learn about the utility business and our platform's business context, you'll succeed.

Responsibilities

  • Learn about and contribute to the development of new features for energy management products that help customers reduce their energy and water usage.
  • Work alongside experienced engineers to deliver features and learn the ropes of coding, testing, and debugging.
  • Contribute to solving bugs and improving the performance of existing Opower platform or product features in collaboration with team members.
  • Help develop complex web modules and their supporting back-end services using Java , JavaScript, NodeJS, React, and Redux.
  • Use test-driven development to ensure all code is thoroughly tested using Enzyme, Karma, Storybooks, Loki, Ava, Selenium, and Junit.
  • Triage, troubleshoot, and fix bugs anywhere in the web module stack, from React web components to Java Dropwizard services.
  • Own small-to-medium sized tasks or features, including writing simple design summaries to guide your work.


Required Skills

  • To be graduated with a bachelorâ€™s or or to be close to completing a Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Basic knowledge of at least one programming language (Java, JavaScript, Python, etc.).
  • Some experience with JavaScript, HTML, CSS, or any related web technologies is appreciated.
  • A basic understanding of software development principles (e.g., version control, testing, agile practices, etc.).
  • A strong desire to learn about software development, cloud technologies, and distributed systems.
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
  • Self-driven, curious, and motivated to learn and grow as a software engineer.


At Oracle, we donâ€™t just respect differencesâ€”we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. Itâ€™s when everyoneâ€™s voice is heard and valued that weâ€™re inspired to go beyond whatâ€™s been done before. https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/

Career Level - IC2

Qualifications

Career Level - IC2

About Us

Only Oracle brings together the data, infrastructure, applications, and expertise to power everything from industry innovations to life-saving care. And with AI embedded across our products and services, we help customers turn that promise into a better future for all. Discover your potential at a company leading the way in AI and cloud solutions that impact billions of lives.

True innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to growing a workforce that promotes opportunities for all with competitive benefits that support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

Weâ€™re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request_mb@oracle.com or by calling 1-888-404-2494 in the United States.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veteransâ€™ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Software Engineer
description_html:
Meet the Team

Cisco's Webex Engineering Group is redefining the future of collaboration. We're building a world where people connect effortlessly to enjoy modern, uncompromised collaboration across every room, desk, pocket, and application.

Our technology powers industry-leading products like Slido, Webex Meetings, Webex Calling, and Webex Contact Center. As a member of our team, your work will ensure every user gets a truly immersive experience regardless of device or location, empowering the hybrid working patterns of the future.

Our team is based in Bratislava. We operate a hybrid working model.

Your Impact

  • Develop and maintain software features and improvements to our products.
  • Write clean, secure, and maintainable code following engineering best practices.
  • Debug, test, and fix issues in development and production environments.
  • Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver the right solutions for customers.
  • Learn and apply modern software development tools, frameworks, and workflows and share learnings with the team.
  • Participate in code reviews, incorporate feedback, and continuously improve code quality.
  • Contribute to technical documentation and user-facing documentation as needed.
  • Gain exposure to the operational side of our distributed systems and highly available microservices.
  • Leverage AI technologies to accelerate the teamâ€™s productivity and the delivery of customer features.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a technical field or 1+ year of professional experience in software development.
  • Basic knowledge of software development concepts gained through coursework, projects, or internships and a willingness to learn new technologies quickly.
  • Flexible, thrives in diverse team environments, and communicates clearly and precisely.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of the following programming languages: Java or C++ (system development), Node.js, JavaScript, Python is a plus.
  • Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases is a plus.
  • Familiar with AI coding tools (Codex, Cursor, Copilot).
  • Familiarity with Git, DevOps, continuous integration, continuous delivery.
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to continuous learning and quality results.
  • Ability to apply creative skills to complex problems.

We provide training and mentoring for all new team members to fill in any gaps.

Why Cisco?

At Cisco, weâ€™re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era â€“ and beyond. Weâ€™ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.

Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and youâ€™ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.

We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: Software Engineer
description_html:
Meet the Team

Cisco's Webex Engineering Group is redefining the future of collaboration. We're building a world where people connect effortlessly to enjoy modern, uncompromised collaboration across every room, desk, pocket, and application.

Our technology powers industry-leading products like Slido, Webex Meetings, Webex Calling, and Webex Contact Center. As a member of our team, your work will ensure every user gets a truly immersive experience regardless of device or location, empowering the hybrid working patterns of the future.

Our team is based in Bratislava. We operate a hybrid working model.

Your Impact

  • Develop and maintain software features and improvements to our products.
  • Write clean, secure, and maintainable code following engineering best practices.
  • Debug, test, and fix issues in development and production environments.
  • Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to deliver the right solutions for customers.
  • Learn and apply modern software development tools, frameworks, and workflows and share learnings with the team.
  • Participate in code reviews, incorporate feedback, and continuously improve code quality.
  • Contribute to technical documentation and user-facing documentation as needed.
  • Gain exposure to the operational side of our distributed systems and highly available microservices.
  • Leverage AI technologies to accelerate the teamâ€™s productivity and the delivery of customer features.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a technical field or 1+ year of professional experience in software development.
  • Basic knowledge of software development concepts gained through coursework, projects, or internships and a willingness to learn new technologies quickly.
  • Flexible, thrives in diverse team environments, and communicates clearly and precisely.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of the following programming languages: Java or C++ (system development), Node.js, JavaScript, Python is a plus.
  • Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases is a plus.
  • Familiar with AI coding tools (Codex, Cursor, Copilot).
  • Familiarity with Git, DevOps, continuous integration, continuous delivery.
  • Strong attention to detail and a commitment to continuous learning and quality results.
  • Ability to apply creative skills to complex problems.

We provide training and mentoring for all new team members to fill in any gaps.

Why Cisco?

At Cisco, weâ€™re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era â€“ and beyond. Weâ€™ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.

Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and youâ€™ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere.

We are Cisco, and our power starts with you.

title: SuccessFactors Application Maintenance Specialist
description_html:
About Technology Consulting

We connect the world of business with technologies from design to implementation. In Technology Consulting, you are not only a part of PwC, but you will also get the opportunity to get to know life in other companies. Usually, we are part of project teams responsible for the design and delivery of innovative and high-quality Business and Technology solutions for our clients in the Czech Republic and other European countries.

We are developing our skill sets not only when working with our clients but also in additional activities. We have six communities, where we learn about specific topics â€“ Self-Mastery, Innovations and Start-up Development, Data Management, Digital Strategy, SAP, AI

About Your Manager

Eva HlavÃ¡ÄovÃ¡ leads the Employee Central & Compensation team for SAP SuccessFactors. She dedicates her professional life to the implementation of HR systems for Czech and international clients. When she's not at work, she likes skiing, yoga and books.

Job Description & Summary

Are you looking to advance your career in HR IT with a focus on supporting and enhancing modern HR systems? Do you enjoy ensuring stability, continuously improving system functionality, and helping organizations get the most out of their HR technologies? We are looking for an Application Maintenance Expert with handsâ€‘on experience in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to join our global HR IT operations team.

In this role, you will work closely with HR system owners, key users, and technical teams to ensure the smooth operation of Employee Central and related modules. You will be responsible for issue analysis, configuration updates, enhancements, release management and testing. You can also gain additional experience by supporting your colleagues during peak times on the implementation projects. You will apply your analytical skills, functional understanding, and attention to detail to keep the platform reliable, compliant, and continuously improving.

Requirements of the role

  • Strong interest in HRIT solutions and modern HR technology trends.
  • Practical experience with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central (admin, configuration, or operational support).
  • Experience with additional SAP SuccessFactors modules is an advantage.
  • Willingness to work on configuration changes, incident resolution, problem management, and system enhancements.
  • Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
  • Ability to communicate technical topics in a businessâ€‘friendly and userâ€‘friendly way.
  • Fluent in Czech and English; German is an advantage.
  • Willingness for occasional international travel.
  • University degree.

Our Benefits and Funâ€¯

  • Concentrated experience and rapid career growth. It may sound like a platitude, but it really is.â€¯
  • Fair salary plus paid overtime and flexible working hours.
  • Paid time off 25 days, 3 wellbeing days and 2 extra days off from the company at the end of the year.â€¯
  • High-end Ultrabook and iPhone with unlimited data.â€¯
  • Benefit program with 45.000 points that you can use for holidays, education, food vouchers, sports, health... Simply on what you enjoy.â€¯â€¯
  • Supporting your development and education: business and digital skills training (e.g. Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau), ongoing training and certifications, e.g. Microsoft (Azure, PowerApps), project management (Prince2, PMI), service management (ITIL), agile development (Scrum, SAFe), DAMA, Salesforce, coaching and presentation skills and more. And various training within our technology communities.â€¯
  • Opportunity to work in the future at a foreign PwC office, for example in the USA, Canada and there are others in the selection.â€¯â€¯
  • Extra-work activities and Away Days (team building, ski weekend, etc.).â€¯â€¯
  • Regular feedback on your work, also consultation with a coach with whom you can address your further development and career direction.â€¯

PwC is the largest audit team in the Czech Republic, but also law, tax, consulting and technology, data or forensic teams. Find out how easy it is to combine this knowledge when you're in the right place. With us, you will get the opportunity to see how business is done in large companies. We are part of an international network of companies with more than 364,000 colleagues in 151 countries. At PwC, we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can be themselves and find their place and opportunity to develop. We have successfully maintained the prestigious Equal Pay Certification, making us one of only four companies in the Czech Republic (and the only one from the Big 4) that demonstrably implements fair compensation practices regardless of gender.â€¯

Are you interested in our offer? Let us know about yourself and we will discuss more details together!â€¯

title: Data Analyst
description_html:
Our opportunity

Data Analystâ€¯(Catastrophe Modelling)

Support delivery of data-centric IT solutions for catastrophe portfolio modeling. Design and manage cloud-based data pipelines (Databricks/Azure), ensuring scalability, performance, and traceability.

Your role

As a Data Analyst, your main responsibilities will include:

  • Design, document, and oversee data ingestion and transformation pipelines on cloud platforms.
  • Translate business goals into clear requirements, user stories, and technical solutions.
  • Collaborate with risk modelers and technical teams on workflows for exposure data and catastrophe model results.
  • Analyze and transform diverse data sources for informed decision-making and regulatory compliance.
  • Facilitate agile ceremonies and ensure alignment between business and technical stakeholders.
  • Support development, testing, and release planningâ€”emphasizing performance, security, and business value.
  • Advocate for robust data architecture; liaise with Data Architects and Information Security.
  • Provide functional consulting and drive adoption among internal users and data providers.

Your Skills And Experience

As a Data Analyst, your skills and experience will ideally include:

  • Expert T-SQL skills for complex querying and performance tuning.
  • Experience with data science tools (e.g., R, Python).
  • Strong background in data modeling, transformation, visualization, and governance.
  • Hands-on with data pipelines/ETL tools (Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Jenkins).
  • Able to design and manage data flows in cloud environments, familiarity with full software lifecycle.
  • Experience supporting legacy platforms and leading requirements workshops.
  • Skilled in stakeholder management within a matrixed organization.
  • Proven agile delivery (Scrum/Kanban).
  • Fluent in English.
  • Experience with UAT, release planning, and performance/security validation.
  • Familiarity with insurance risk modeling or exposure data.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with Apache Spark, Delta Lake, Databricks.
  • Exposure to catastrophe modeling platforms (RiskLink, Touchstone).
  • Knowledge of regulatory reporting and internal risk frameworks.
  • Insurance and catastrophe modeling expertise.

We offer

In accordance with the EU Pay Transparency Directive, the minimum gross monthly compensation for this position, determined based on objective and gender-neutral criteria, is 2 900 EUR/gross. The final compensation package will depend on the candidateâ€™s qualifications and relevant experience.â€¯

Working Time Benefits

Personal days off, Concentrated work week, Additional vacation, Home office, Extra days off at occasion of childbirth, Sabbatical leave, Workcation

Monetary Benefits

Life insurance from Zurich Austria, Compensation for salary loss during sick leave, 3rd pension pillar contribution, Risk Life Insurance, Meal contribution on top of the legally required minimum, Years of service bonus, Wedding bonus, Baby bonus

Other Benefits

Electronic cafeteria, Maternity leave benefits, Massages in the office

Learning/Development

Professional Certifications, Online Education Portals, Extensive Onboarding program, Strengths based culture (GALLUP)

  • Location(s):â€¯Bratislava
  • Hybrid working:â€¯It would be nice to meet you in the office 3 times a week, if you live close by
  • Schedule:â€¯Full-time

About Us

At our company, we recognize the importance of fostering an open-minded, safe and inclusive environment for everyone. We stand with diversity and respect different backgrounds and lifestyles. That's why we've implemented numerous initiatives to ensure our employees feel comfortable, accepted, and respected at all times.

title: System Engineer I - Anthem Flight Controls
description_html:
Job Description

Step into the cockpit of innovationâ€¦

Honeywellâ€™s Flight Systems team is building Honeywell Anthemâ€”a nextâ€‘generation avionics platform redefining flight across Business Aviation, Regional Jets, General Aviation, and Urban Air Mobility. This is your chance to join a cuttingâ€‘edge aerospace program where bold ideas take off fast.

Weâ€™re looking for a Junior System Engineer ready to learn, explore, and contribute to Automatic Flight Control Systems (AFCS). Youâ€™ll help develop key functions like Autopilot, Autothrottle, Flight Director, Trims, and Yaw Damper. Youâ€™ll work closely with an experienced team and grow alongside a brandâ€‘new product line.

An excellent opportunity for an emerging systems or aerospace engineer â€” including recent graduates committed to developing their career in aerospace systems engineering.

This is a hybrid role, 3 days at the office + 2 days work from home model.

Responsibilities

Your Mission in AeroSpace

  • Perform the design and development of automatic flight control systems, ensuring they meet project and customer requirements.
  • Model-Based development using MATLAB/Simulink.
  • Conduct validation and verification/testing of the system to ensure compliance with requirements and aerospace industry standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate hardware and software components into cohesive systems.

Qualifications

To succeed in this mission, youâ€™ll bringâ€¦

  • A strong technical launchpad â€” a Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s in Avionics, Aerospace, Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, Control Systems, or Industrial Automation.
  • Clear communication in English and the confidence to collaborate across a fastâ€‘paced, global environment.
  • A selfâ€‘propelled mindset â€” proactive, independent, motivated, and ready to take initiative when the mission calls for it.
  • Analytical sharpness and calm under pressure, able to dissect complex problems and stay steady in demanding situations.
  • Global readiness â€” high integrity, eligibility for exportâ€‘license requirements, and the willingness to travel abroad for training, meetings, and customer support.

We Value

  • Familiarity with engineering tools such as MATLAB/Simulink, or similar tools used in systems development, modeling and simulation.
  • Knowledge of scripting language (e.g. Python)
  • Previous experience with one or more of the following: systems engineering, systems verification, model-based design, requirements management, or aerospace industry (e.g. during an internship/part-time job/diploma thesis)
  • Basic understanding of aircraft/avionics functions and design

We Offer

  • Enjoy 25 vacation days per year
  • Meal allowance
  • Benefit Plus Cafeteria Card available to all employees
  • To promote health and wellbeing we provide life insurance coverage, employer contribution to Pension saving scheme or long-term investment product (DIP)
  • Multisport Card, Makro Card, discount at T-Mobile tariffs and multiple discount programs in our partner network
  • 3 plus 2 hybrid work arrangement to support your work-life balance
  • Flexible working hours
  • Work in international environment
  • Recognition & Referral bonus programs
  • Employee Assistance Program - Free and confidential service to help with any difficulties regarding work, life and personal or family matters
  • Honeywell Learning & Development Center â€“ learning platform with over 10,000 courses from Udemy
  • Frequent Employee Engagement activities fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment
  • Global employee networks to help you connect and grow
  • Comprehensive induction, ongoing training, and development to set you up for success, in-house and external learning platforms supporting development opportunities

Join Honeywell - A Global Leader in Innovation!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

At Honeywell, we are proud to be an international employer with a robust presence in over 70 countries. Our diverse workforce fosters innovation through collaboration and inclusiveness.

We are seeking dynamic individuals who thrive in fast-paced environments to join our team. Here, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to work alongside talented professionals from around the world, contributing to exciting projects and pioneering solutions that impact industries globally.

At Honeywell, your career can soar with access to global resources and continuous development programs. If you are ready to take your professional journey to the next level, explore our opportunities today!

Ready to take off? Apply now and be part of something extraordinary!

About Us

Honeywell helps organizations solve the world's most complex challenges in automation, the future of aviation and energy transition. As a trusted partner, we provide actionable solutions and innovation through our Aerospace Technologies, Building Automation, Energy and Sustainability Solutions, and Industrial Automation business segments â€“ powered by our Honeywell Forge software â€“ that help make the world smarter, safer and more sustainable.

title: Software Engineering Intern
description_html:
Weâ€™re searching for the bold and the brilliant. Are you fueled by ambition and eager to innovate? At Tricentis, weâ€™re offering internships that let you make an impact, share your ideas, and gain hands on experience in the tech industry. If youâ€™re ready to showcase your talents and join a team at the forefront of software testing, we want to hear from you.

Why join Tricentis?

The Software Engineering Intern role at Tricentis provides you with a unique opportunity to work on an impressive technology landscape involving many of the most popular tools and cloud platforms of today. You will utilize your skills and expertise to extend our product capabilities by developing features using the latest technologies and best practices.

Our teams are global, diverse, and agile. These teams collaborate worldwide requiring us to embrace flexibility, innovation, and inclusivity. And that's not all. We'll value your unique contributions, celebrate your achievements, and offer a platform for you to grow during this journey.

Who Are We Looking For

We are looking for an energetic, intelligent, creative, and driven Software Engineering Intern to join us for a 3 month, full-time, office-based internship, starting 1st of July 2026. Please note that we currently do not offer fully remote positions and we do not provide visa sponsorship or relocation assistance at this time.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, validate, and ship code as part of an Engineering team.
  • Work on SaaS products and services.
  • Go beyond just coding but learn critical aspects of software development including demos, secure design, CI/CD, IaC, observability, and many more.
  • Document your journey and share as part of your capstone presentation.
  • Collaborate across different teams, locations, and products to deliver your work.

Skillset Needed

  • Working knowledge of a programming language (ideally Java, C#, JavaScript/Typescript, or Python)
  • Understanding of basic testing strategies (ex. unit testing)
  • Embrace change; this will be a learning experience and require resiliency.
  • Growth mindset, you seek to learn new things and seek out opportunities to maximize this internship opportunity.
  • English

If youâ€™ve got some of the following, even better:

  • Hands on experience with AI coding assistants (ex. Cursor, Claude Code)
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (ex. Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Some knowledge of Cloud Providers (ex AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Knowledge of database technologies (ex. Postgres, Mongo, MySQL).

Tricentis is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, gender, religious affiliation, age, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, or physical and mental disability and other statuses protected by law.

Global Sanctions Compliance

We comply with all applicable global sanctions and export control laws. Candidates must not be listed on any government restricted party lists (including OFAC SDN List and U.S. Commerce Department restricted lists) and must certify that their employment would not violate any sanctions or export control regulations. Candidates must notify us of any changes to their status during the application process or subsequent employment.
